[[Image:Command prompt on windows vista.png|thumb|300px|The [[cmd.exe]] command line interface in [[Windows Vista]]]]
'''Command Line Interface''' ('''CLI''') is a mechanism for interacting with a computer [[operating system]] or System [[software]] by typing commands to perform specific tasks. This contrasts with the use of a [[Mouse (computing)|mouse pointer]] with a '''[[graphical user interface]]''' ('''GUI''') to click on options, or menus on a [[Text user interface]] (TUI) to select options.
'''Command Line Interface''' ('''CLI''') is a mechanism for interacting with a computer [[operating system]] or System [[software]] by typing commands to perform specific tasks. This contrasts with the use of a [[Mouse (computing)|mouse pointer]] with a '''[[graphical user interface]]''' ('''GUI''') to click on options, or menus on a [[Text user interface]] (TUI) to select options.
